188.sentence: I could probably use a trash can and be ok at this point, but this prduct seems to work very well so far.

190.sentence: I actually took a friends word on it and went with this Champ when registering and I am glad I did.

191.sentence: Well the Champ has survived it's first year with our son and it is great!!

192.sentence: The thought of not having to buy refills and just using regular bags is awesome!

193.sentence: We just buy the smaller bags that come like 250 to a roll and are sented and they are like $6.00 and they work great.

194.sentence: We just recently had to buy another roll of bags. SO $6.00 for a year of bags- can't beat that!!

195.sentence: We lysol the champ every time we change the bag out and have not had any problems.

196.sentence: This is really a nice diaper pail.

197.sentence: I recommend it to both parents of infants and toddlers.

198.sentence: In fact, I liked it so much after using it with my son who is now 2 years old, that I bought one for our new baby's room.

199.sentence: Wow - was that disappointing and we didn't even have it 6 months before it broke.

200.sentence: I bought the Diaper Champ and have been very happy for the following reasons.

201.sentence: 1.  The Diaper Champ doesn't require special refills that are expensive and hard to find!

202.sentence: We just use the Glad tall kitchen trash can bags with odor shield from Target and they work wonderfully.

203.sentence: We don't have to worry about running out of refills with this diaper pail!

204.sentence: 2.  It can be operated with one hand - Leaving a hand on your baby on the changing table.

205.sentence: So much safer than the others that require a two handed operation!

206.sentence: The Diaper Champ is so simple that my toddler loves to put his own diapers in the diaper champ and flip over the handle.

208.sentence: Yes, you may get a whiff of a smell when you flip the handle, but then it is gone.

209.sentence: To eliminate any smells we simple stuck a Stick Up room deodorizer inside the lid.
